author: SebMouren
body:
Hello,
If I enter the line `Install-Module PowerShellGet -Force -AllowClobber` on a fresh MSIX Powershell 6.2.4 deployment, it sends me a `WARNING: The version '1.4.6' of module "PackageManagement' is currently in use. Retry after closing the applications` every time I try to install the module and doesn't install the module.
If I enter the line `Install-Module PowerShellGet -Force -AllowClobber -Verbose` **it works**: it deploy a more recent `PowerShellGet` module in the 'C:\Users\%USERNAME%\Documents\Powershell\Modules\PowerShellGet\2.2.3'

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @SebMouren Please move the issue to PowerShellGet repo.

comments.author: SebMouren
comments.body: Yep, I'll do that but I forgot to mention that it doesn't append with a freshly installed MSI Powershell 6.2.4 deployment on another machine. It looks like -before I dig in- that it is related to differences between the MSI and MSIX package.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: MSI and MSIX can be very different in behavior.

title: PowerShell 6.2.4 MSIX unable to Install-Module PowerShellGet -Force -AllowClobber
